Headline: Ketchup maker Kraft Heinz investing $3 billion upgrading U.S. manufacturing: Reuters
Summary: The upgrades will help lower costs by making the plants more efficient, which in turn may help offset President Donald Trump's tariffs.

Headline: Sony warns this year’s profit won’t grow at all due to tariffs
Summary: Japanese consumer electronics giant Sony warned on Wednesday that this year’s profits won’t grow at all because of tariffs.

Headline: How Trump’s tariffs are ending the American century and boosting China’s power
Summary: The Geneva trade negotiations mark the beginning of China-Asia dominance in world affairs.

Headline: Trump should aim for zero tariffs. It could usher in a golden age for Americans.
Summary: How “tariff zero” would expand opportunities for American exporters and help U.S. companies sell to the world.

Headline: Hertz shares plummet after company's disappointing first-quarter results, $250 million stock offering
Summary: Shares of Hertz plummeted Tuesday morning following the company reporting disappointing first-quarter earnings and fleet cuts amid slower bookings and tariffs.

Headline: Consumer prices show mild increase, but trade wars likely to add to inflation despite reduced tariffs
Summary: U.S. inflation rate slows to 2.3%, CPI shows. Smallest increase since 2021.

Headline: These 10 tech stocks could benefit most from softening U.S.-China tariffs
Summary: While investors will be more positive on the sector overall, Apple and Dell are among the tech companies that could see particular relief from recent developments.

Headline: Why the stock market is going to love higher U.S. tariffs on China
Summary: The Trump administration is serious about using tariffs to generate revenue that funds tax cuts.

Headline: Consumer prices likely rebounded in April as higher tariffs began to bite
Summary: Consumer prices likely rebounded in April as the first bite to Americans’ pocketbooks started to hit, economists say.

Headline: Toy stocks rally after Chinese tariffs slashed to 30%
Summary: Shares of Mattel, Hasbro, Jakks and Funko rallied on Monday after the U.S. agreed to temporarily reduce tariffs on China.
